content:
@WG-prioritization/alerts issue #92755 has been requested for prioritization.

Procedure

  • Priority?
  • Regression?
  • Notify people/groups?
  • Needs I-nominated?

by judging on the piling up on this issue (and the fact that it was pinned), I'd say P-high

note: this seems to be a regression from nightly so only if prioritized as p-high the compiler team will see it during the meeting
P-high sounds good, although P-critical may make sense as well
Actually, this really seems P-critical to me: it's working code -> ICE, it occurs in real code (e.g., cranelift), and AFAICT there's no workaround
Actually, after hearing Noah's points, I agree with P-critical.
also (fwiw) the target is at most tier 2
uh sorry forget what I said, I've read wasmtime/wasmer and got confused
I'm going to tag it P-critical for the time being.
The good news is that a likely fix is already up. Hopefully this will be dealt with soon.
